overview_of_class: Fundamentals of Neurology will explore the structure and function of the central nervous system, from the molecular to the systems/behavioral level. This course will provide an introduction to a number fo concepts in cellular and systems neurology, with a emphasis on: ion channel structure and function; the structure and function of neurons and glia; the ionic basis of the membrane potential, graded potential and action potential; synaptic physiology, neuromodulation, neuronal networks; neural plasticity, including learning and memory
name: Fundamentals of Neurobiology
subject: BIOL_SCI
